intro: Seseli mucronatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf seseli, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features slender, upright stems with finely divided, feathery leaves. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
